title: List of parties to international copyright agreements
text:
Below is a list of countries which have signed and <a href="Ratification">ratified</a> one or more multilateral <a href="international%20copyright%20treaties">international copyright treaties</a>. This list covers only <a href="Multilateral%20treaty">multilateral treaties</a> (i.e., treaties by more than two countries). It does not include <a href="Bilateral%20treaty">bilateral treaties</a> (treaties between only two countries). <a href="Related%20rights">Related rights</a> provide <a href="intellectual%20property">intellectual property</a> rights for performers, producers of sound recordings (<a href="Sound%20recording%20and%20reproduction">phonogram</a>s) and broadcasting organisations. In some countries these rights are known simply as <a href="copyright">copyright</a>, while other countries distinguish them from <a href="authors%27%20rights">authors' rights</a>: in either case, the international laws which are concerned with them are distinct from those concerned with literary and artistic works under the <a href="Berne%20Convention%20for%20the%20Protection%20of%20Literary%20and%20Artistic%20Works">Berne Convention for the Protection of Literary and Artistic Works</a> and other treaties.
Treaties.
In addition to these treaties, the <a href="Anti-Counterfeiting%20Trade%20Agreement">Anti-Counterfeiting Trade Agreement</a> (ACTA) is a multilateral treaty governing multiple aspects of intellectual property, including copyright. , ACTA has been signed by 31 countries, but only ratified by Japan. If ACTA is ratified by six or more signatories, it will enter into force thirty days later.
, <a href="Eritrea">Eritrea</a>, <a href="Marshall%20Islands">Marshall Islands</a>, <a href="Nauru">Nauru</a>, <a href="Palau">Palau</a>, and WTO Observer countries <a href="Iran">Iran</a>, <a href="Iraq">Iraq</a>, <a href="Ethiopia">Ethiopia</a>, <a href="Somalia">Somalia</a>, and <a href="South%20Sudan">South Sudan</a> are not a party to any copyright convention.
Table of parties.
The list below was taken from details supplied by <a href="WIPO">WIPO</a>, <a href="UNESCO">UNESCO</a> and the <a href="WTO">WTO</a> (see <a href="%23References">references</a>): they are
correct as of 2005-12-11 (2000-01-01 for the Universal Copyright Convention), and include some accessions after that date. Dates quoted are the date on which the treaty came into effect for a given country.
